abstract: Banks led by JPMorgan Chase and Morgan Stanley stand to make a combined $120 million on General Motors’s initial public offering. If it weren’t for Goldman Sachs, they could have made four times as much.
snippet: Banks led by JPMorgan Chase and Morgan Stanley stand to make a combined $120 million on General Motors’s initial public offering. If it weren’t for Goldman Sachs, they could have made four times as much.
lead_paragraph: 8:24 a.m. | Updated Wall Street banks led by JPMorgan Chase and Morgan Stanley stand to make a combined $120 million on General Motors’s initial public offering. If it weren’t for Goldman Sachs, they could have made four times as much, Bloomberg news reported.

headline.main: Goldman Said to Cost Rivals Fees in G.M. Offering

abstract: The former government official who let Timothy F. Geithner stay at his home shortly after becoming Treasury secretary has moved on to JPMorgan Chase.
snippet: The former government official who let Timothy F. Geithner stay at his home shortly after becoming Treasury secretary has moved on to JPMorgan Chase.
lead_paragraph: The former government official who let Timothy F. Geithner stay at his home shortly after becoming Treasury secretary has moved on to JPMorgan Chase.
